headline: Voyager Announces Fourth Quarter 2025 Earnings Results Call
summary: DENVER, February 12, 2026--Voyager Technologies (NYSE: VOYG) will host its fourth quarter 2025 earnings results conference call Tuesday, March 10, 2026, at 9 a.m. ET with the senior management team. Fourth quarter 2025 results will be published after the market closes Monday, March 9, 2026.

Fourth quarter 2025 results will be published after the market closes Monday, March 9, 2026.

headline: Crypto Weekly: $40 billion error sees 620,000 bitcoins given away
summary:
STORY: From a $40 billion error to disappointing revenue for Robinhood. 

This is Crypto Weekly.

:: Crypto Weekly

:: Bithumb's $40 billion error

South Korea's Bithumb said serious flaws left the crypto exchange's internal system vulnerable to possible sabotage.

And that it failed to stop the mistaken transfer of more than $40 billion in assets last week.

The virtual asset exchange said it accidentally gave away about 620,000 bitcoins to customers during a promotional event, instead of 620,000 won or $426.

It triggered a 17% slump in bitcoin's price.

Bithumb CEO Lee Jae-won said the giveaway amounted to 15 times the exchange's holding of 42,000 bitcoins.

 "First of all, we sincerely apologise to the people for the distress caused by the news of the erroneous transfer. We also extend our heartfelt apologies to our customers who have placed their trust in the Republic of Korea's digital asset market, to the lawmakers who work tirelessly for the sound development of the industry, and to the officials at the financial authorities, for the immeasurable concern we have caused."

Most of the bitcoins have been retrieved by the exchange.

But regulators say 1,786 had already been sold within minutes before the exchange froze the accounts of the customers that received them.

:: Britain seeks to block HTX

Britain's Financial Conduct Authority has asked social media companies and app stores to block access to crypto exchange HTX in the UK.

The UK is stepping up efforts to prevent the group from promoting what it sees as "illegal" crypto asset services.

The regulator said it also wanted Alphabet's Google and Apple to remove HTX products from UK app stores.

HTX didn't respond to a request for comment.

:: Robinhood's revenue disappoints

Robinhood's fourth-quarter revenue missed Wall Street expectations this week.

That's as a turbulent quarter for digital assets weighed on the company's crypto trading revenue.

The news sent the retail brokerage's shares down.

The California-based company reported record revenue of $1.28 billion during the three months ended December 31st.

headline: Vanguard’s Mid Cap Growth Filter Fails to Deliver on Its Investor Promise
summary: If you’re building a portfolio that needs exposure to mid-cap companies with growth potential, you’re choosing between two paths: buying a broad mid-cap fund and accepting whatever mix of value and growth you get, or isolating the growth segment specifically. Vanguard Mid-Cap Growth Index Fund ETF Shares (NYSEARCA:VOT) takes the second approach, filtering for mid-cap ... Vanguard’s Mid Cap Growth Filter Fails to Deliver on Its Investor Promise

headline: Robinhood price target lowered to $124 from $159 at Barclays
summary: Barclays lowered the firm’s price target on Robinhood (HOOD) to $124 from $159 and keeps an Overweight rating on the shares following the Q4 report. The company’s missed on revenue but remains focused on its “ambitious” long-term goals, the analyst tells investors in a research note. The firm expects Robinhood’s recent slowdown in net new asset growth to weigh on the shares today. The stock in morning trading is down 12%, or $10.50, to $75.10. headline: Why Robinhood (HOOD) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of financial services company Robinhood (NASDAQ:HOOD) fell 8.5% in the morning session after the company reported fourth-quarter financial results that missed revenue expectations, driven by a sharp decline in cryptocurrency trading activity. While Robinhood's total revenue grew 27% year-over-year to about $1.28 billion, it fell short of analysts' forecasts, which were closer to $1.34 billion. The main cause of the shortfall was a significant 38% drop in revenue from crypto transactions,
